java112.analyzer

Class TokenSizeAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java112.analyzer.TokenSizeAnalyzer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Analyzer

    public class TokenSizeAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Analyzer
    The TokenSizeAnalyzer class will determine the size distribution of the tokens in the input file
    Author:
    sschwert

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TokenSizeAnalyzer()
      empty constructor for TokenSizeAnalyzer class instantiates the Map
      TokenSizeAnalyzer(java.util.Properties properties)
      constructor for TokenSizeAnalyzer class calls the empty constructor

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double calculateScaleAmount()
      the calculateScaleAmount method calls the getLargestValue method and divides the result into the maximumSize instance variable to find the scaleAmount
      int getMaximumSize()
      This is the get method for the maximumSize instance variable
      java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getTokenSizes()
      This is the get method for the tokenSizes instance variable
      java.lang.String makeYouSeeStars(double numberOfTokensInEntry)
      the makeYouSeeStars method is the part I had the hardest time figuring out.
      void printHistogram(java.io.PrintWriter writer)
      the printHistogram method writes each token and a line of stars representing the occurence of that token
      void printTokenSize(java.io.PrintWriter writer)
      the printTokenCounts method writes each token and value in the map to the file
      void processToken(java.lang.String token)
      The process token method is from the interface and will scan each token as it comes in, see if it is already a key in the tokenSizes map and add it to the count if it is or add it to the map if it isn't
      void writeOutputFile(java.lang.String inputFilePath)
      The writeOutputFile method is from the interface and will call the method that will create a file containing a list of the different sizes of tokens represented and their occurence as well as a flexible histogram representing the token size distribution

    • Method Detail

      • processToken

        public void processToken(java.lang.String token)
        The process token method is from the interface and will scan each token as it comes in, see if it is already a key in the tokenSizes map and add it to the count if it is or add it to the map if it isn't
        Specified by:
        processToken in interface Analyzer
        Parameters:
        token - a String that is a single token from AnalyzeFile

      • writeOutputFile

        public void writeOutputFile(java.lang.String inputFilePath)
        The writeOutputFile method is from the interface and will call the method that will create a file containing a list of the different sizes of tokens represented and their occurence as well as a flexible histogram representing the token size distribution
        Specified by:
        writeOutputFile in interface Analyzer
        Parameters:
        inputFilePath - String for the input file path from the command line

      • getMaximumSize

        public int getMaximumSize()
        This is the get method for the maximumSize instance variable
        Returns:
        maximumSize, an int that represents the maximum possible length of asterisks (80)

      • getTokenSizes

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getTokenSizes()
        This is the get method for the tokenSizes instance variable
        Returns:
        tokenSizes, a Map that represents the length of a token as a key and the number of tokens with the key's length

      • calculateScaleAmount

        public double calculateScaleAmount()
        the calculateScaleAmount method calls the getLargestValue method and divides the result into the maximumSize instance variable to find the scaleAmount
        Returns:
        scaleAmount a double that will be used to make the histogram resizable

      • makeYouSeeStars

        public java.lang.String makeYouSeeStars(double numberOfTokensInEntry)
        the makeYouSeeStars method is the part I had the hardest time figuring out. this is the one that made me cry in front of Debbie and question whether I was capable of being a Java developer or should just slink back to design. Why? Because apparently this concept is super easy for some people to figure out and I am not one of them... This took me almost 8 hours to figure out. On the plus side, I eliminated 45 other possible methods that didn't work.
        Returns:
        starLine a String that represents the occurence of a single entry
